ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Time Point
Notes: 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Respondent: Other (specify)
The only time I'm certain my child loves me is when he or she is smiling at me.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I always know what my child wants.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I like to think about the reasons behind the way my child behaves and feels.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: My child cries/acts up/is difficult around strangers to embarrass me.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I can completely read my child's mind.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I wonder a lot about what my child is thinking and feeling.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I find it hard to actively participate in make believe/imaginary activities with my child.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I can always predict what my child will do.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I am often curious to find out how my child feels.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: My child sometimes gets sick/ill to keep me from doing what I want to do.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I can sometimes misunderstand the reactions of my child.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I try to see situations through the eyes of my child.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: When my child is fussy/being difficult he or she does that just to annoy me.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I always know why I do what I do to my child.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I try to understand the reasons why my child misbehaves.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: Often, my child's behavior is too confusing to bother figuring out.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I always know why my child acts the way he or she does.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: I believe there is no point in trying to guess what my child feels.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 4 = Neutral or undecided; 7 = Strongly agree; 8 = No response

ElementDescription: Parental Reflective Functioning Questionnaire Score
Notes: Sum of elements prfq_1 through prfq_18

ElementDescription: PRFQ Pre-Mentalizing Modes Score
Notes: Sum of items prfq_1, prfq_4, prfq_7, prfq_10, prfq_13, prfq_16

ElementDescription: PRFQ Certainty about Mental States Score
Notes: Sum of items prfq_2, prfq_5, prfq_8, prfq_11, prfq_14, prfq_17

ElementDescription: PRFQ Interest and Curiosity in Mental States Score
Notes: Sum of items prfq_3, prfq_6, prfq_9, prfq_12, prfq_15, prfq_18
